children.text: Goal 1.1: Acquire Concepts About Print
Demonstrates behavior that indicates attention to a book and turning pages
Shows interest in reading materials while listening to familiar text being read.
Follows communication displays (pictures/objects/ symbols/words) from left to right progression and top to bottom
Attends by watching and/or listening to words/ pictures/objects found in reading environments.
Imitates the one to one correspondence between the spoken word and graphic symbol (picture/word gesture/object
Imitates segmenting graphic symbols of letters, words, or sentences.
Demonstrates correct access to reading material in a meaningful manner.
Match letters or objects in first letter order using an alphabet chart
Recognizes print conventions such as letters, words or sentences represented by pictures, objects, sign, or text.
Matches letters, objects, or words in order using an alphabet chart.
Recognizes print conventions such as letters, words, sentences, punctuation, paragraphs, etc.
Identifies letters, objects, or words in order using an alphabet chart.
Goal 1.2: Acquire Concepts About Text
Points to items named by the teacher to convey understanding of the word (e.g. names, signs, school and classroom objects, etc).
Identifies a book, including front cover, back cover, and title, when provided a visual or tactile representation.
Respond to environmental print with assistance (e.g. signs, symbols
Locates the front cover with title of a book or reading selection.
Attend to simple graphic features in text.
Attend and respond to different kinds of texts types.
Locates the title of a book or reading selection.
Recognize graphic features in text, i.e. charts and diagrams.
Recognize similar types of text and formats.
Responds to the purpose of print conventions such as punctuation, paragraph, bold print, etc
Identify graphic features in text, i.e. graphs, italics, bold print.
Show interest in text types and formats of various kinds of text in the environment.
Identify parts of a book and/or text features to aid in comprehension i.e. title, illustrations.
Identify graphic features that support text meaning.
Identify literary and informational/ functional texts, pictures, and/or media.
Identify parts of a book and/or text features to aid in comprehension, i.e. heading, captions, introductory paragraph.
Identify information using graphic features in text.
Identify literary and informational/ functional texts, pictures, and/or media.
Identify parts of a book and/or text features to aid in comprehension, i.e. directions, sequences, glossary.
Identify graphic features in text that provides information for research topics.
Use literary and informational/ functional texts, pictures, and/or media to understand information in text.
Use parts of a book and/or text features to understand a selection, such as appendix.
Interpret graphic features in text to acquire meaning.
Identify literary and informational/ functional texts, pictures, and/or electronic sources to access information.
Use parts of a book and/or text features to understand a selection.
Use graphic features in text to communicate information.
Identify similarities or differences in structure and format of informational/ functional texts, pictures, and/or media.
Use parts of a book and/or text features to identify different genres of literature.
Identify similarities or differences in structure and format of informational/ functional texts, pictures, and/or media.
Use parts of a book and/or text features to identify different genres of literature.
Identify similarities or differences in structure and format of literary and informational/ functional texts, pictures, and/or media.
Identify similarities or differences in structure and format of literary and informational/ functional texts, pictures, and/or media.
Goal 1.3: Acquire Phonological Awareness Skills
Responds to familiar songs and rhymes.
Imitates or identifies rhyming words.
Identifies when groups of words/pictures/ objects begin with the same sound.
Reproduces simple onsets and rimes to produce real words (e.g. repeats onset /c/ with rime /at/ to produce /cat/
Attends to adults blending spoken phonemes (CVC) to form single syllable words (e.g. /d/…/o/…/g/ says dog and shows picture or object)
Match the initial sound (not the letter) to the initial sound of a spoken word.
Segments one-syllable words into its phonemes, (e.g. using manipulatives to mark each phoneme, imitates an adult)
Identifies syllables in a word.
Identify beginning sounds as same or different.
Change sounds in a word to make a new word.
Uses phonemes to blend into recognizable words, i.e. Name
Segment syllables (beats) in a word.
Goal 1.4: Acquire Decoding Skills Using Word Parts
Reproduces sounds or symbols to match sounds or symbols in similar words.
Match sound to letter symbol.
Imitate reading abbreviations in text appropriate to grade level.
Match letter symbols to sound.
Attend to abbreviations in text appropriate to grade level.
Identify word patterns and/or word families.
Recognizes abbreviations in text appropriate to grade level.
Identify word parts as letters and syllables, i.e. prefix, word families, root word, suffix.
Read simple abbreviations appropriate to grade level.
Use word parts (letters, syllables) to read, i.e. prefix, word family, root word, suffix.
Read simple abbreviations appropriate to grade level.
Use word parts (letters, syllables) to read, i.e. prefix, word family, root word, suffix
Read simple abbreviations appropriate to grade level.
Use word parts (letters, syllables) to decode unfamiliar words, i.e. prefix, word family, root word, suffix
Read simple abbreviations appropriate to grade level.
Use word parts (letters, syllables) to read multisyllable words, i.e. prefix, word family, root word, suffix
Read simple abbreviations appropriate to grade level.
Goal 1.5: Acquire Decoding Skills Using Syllabication
Match letter symbols.
Match common onsets, rimes, and word patterns to generate words.
Identify that letters put together make words.
Identify that letters and syllables put together make words.
Identify that letters and syllables put together make words.
Identify that letters put together with certain rules make words.
Identify that letters put together with certain rules make words.
Identify that letters put together with certain rules make words.
Identify that letters put together with certain rules make words.
Goal 1.6: Acquire Decoding Skills Using Context
Use visual, tactile, and/or auditory prompts to identify new words.
Use visual, tactile, and/or auditory prompts to identify new words.
Use visual, tactile, and/or auditory prompts to identify new words.
Use visual, tactile, and/or auditory prompts to identify new words.

Goal 1.7: Acquire Fluency
Recognizes automatically between 5 to 25 age appropriate high frequency word symbols (i.e. gestures, pictures, objects, words).
Recognizes automatically between 10 to 35 age appropriate high frequency word symbols (i.e. gestures, pictures, objects, words).
Listen to grade 1 appropriate text read aloud by repeating text in choral reading.
Recognizes automatically between 15 to 45 age appropriate high frequency word symbols (i.e. gestures, pictures, objects, words).
Listen to grade 2 appropriate text read aloud by repeating text in choral reading.
Recognizes automatically between 20 to 50 age appropriate high frequency word symbols (i.e. gestures, pictures, objects, words).
Listen to grade 3 appropriate text read aloud by repeating text in choral reading.
Read simplified, grade 4 appropriate text.
Read simplified, grade 5 appropriate text.
Read simplified, grade 6 appropriate text.
Read simplified, grade 7 appropriate text.
Read simplified, grade 8 appropriate text.
Goal 1.8: Vocabulary and Concept Development
Classify common words, pictures and/or objects into basic categories.
Match word meaning in the context in which the word is used (i.e. use picture clues, prompts from spoken words)
Match pictures/objects/ gestures/words and concepts necessary for math, science, social studies and other Kindergarten content area text.
Identify words and concepts of the inflectional ending (i.e. plural, ing).
Match common antonyms using pictures, objects, signs
Match pictures/objects/ gestures/words and concepts necessary for math, science, social studies and other Grade 1 content area text.
Use personal dictionary of pictures/objects, signs, etc to develop concepts and vocabulary.
Identify words and the meaning of inflectional ending, such as singular and plural or –ed.
Identify words that are common opposites or mean the same (antonyms, synonyms).
Match pictures/objects/ gestures/words and concepts necessary for math, science, social studies and other Grade 2 content area text.
Use dictionary materials to develop concepts and vocabulary.
Identify words and the meaning of common suffixes, such as singular and plural.
Identify words and the concepts of same or opposite in meaning (synonyms, antonyms)
Match pictures/objects/ gestures/words and concepts necessary for math, science, social studies and other Grade 3 content area text.
Use dictionary materials to develop concepts and vocabulary.
Identify common words and the meaning of common suffixes, such as singular and plural.
Identify words and the concepts of same or opposite in meaning and same sounds-spelled differently (synonyms, antonyms, homophones)
Match pictures/objects/ gestures/words and concepts necessary for math, science, social studies and other Grade 4 content area text.
Use dictionary materials to develop concepts and vocabulary.
Identify root words and the meaning of common suffixes.
Use context to define words and words that have multiple meanings.
Match pictures/objects/ gestures/words and concepts necessary for math, science, social studies and other Grade 5 content area text.
Use reference materials to develop vocabulary and meaning of words, e.g. dictionary or thesaurus.
Identify common root words and the meaning of other words derived from the root
Use context to define words and words that have multiple meanings.
Match pictures/objects/ gestures/words and concepts necessary for math, science, social studies and other Grade 6 content area text.
Use reference materials to develop vocabulary and meaning of words, e.g. dictionary or thesaurus.
Identify words and the meaning of common prefixes, such as un- or pre-.
Identify word and concept differences, involving antonyms, synonyms, and words with multiple meanings.
Use pictures/ objects/ gestures/ words necessary to clarify, predict, or expand meaning and concepts.
Use reference materials to develop vocabulary and meaning of words such as dictionary or thesaurus.
Identify root words and the meaning of common affixes, such as the meaning of un and ful.
Identify word and concept differences, involving antonyms, synonyms, and words with multiple meanings.
Identify and/or use words and concepts related to each grade 8 content area.
Use reference materials to develop vocabulary and meaning of words, such as dictionary or thesaurus.

Match information and/or events in texts to self.
Identify picture clues, objects, and gestures in context to aid comprehension.
Attend to reading for a purpose (e.g. pleasure, information
Participate in connecting the information and events in texts to self.
Participate in using picture clues and context to identify a conclusion based on text.

Goal 2.2: Acquire Skills to Comprehend Expository Text
